channel.title: Little Router Help
channel.description:
Hello, Im back well recently i found my router info and i need to get all that portforwarding stuff done.
[code]Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:
Name: 1 IP address: 2 TCP Ports to open: 43594 UDP Ports to open: Inbound Filter: Allow All Schedule: Always [/code]
I found that for help, but i am using a netgear router and there is no gaming tab so what do i od?

Photobucket

Photobucket - Photo and image hosting, free photo galleries, photo editing.

Get free image hosting, easy photo sharing, and photo editing. Upload pictures and videos, create with the online photo editor, or browse a photo gallery or album and create custom print products.


www.imageshack.us

– imageshack… you dont have to register
– photobucket… you get a good album!

item.title: Little Router Help
item.dc:creator: @zamathiar zamathiar
item.description:
@zamathiar wrote:

Hello, Im back well recently i found my router info and i need to get all that portforwarding stuff done.

[code]Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always
[/code]

I found that for help, but i am using a netgear router and there is no gaming tab so what do i od?

Read full topic
